stem: Which of the following is INCORRECT regarding Perthes disease?
opt4: Leads to avascular necrosis of the femoral head
disc:
Legg-Calvé-Perthes (LCP) is characterized by idiopathic avascular necrosis of the hip. Commonly affected children are between 3 and 12 years of age (peak between 5 and 7 years). It may affect both hip joints in 1/5 of patients. Males are more commonly affected than females.

Affected children often present with a limp and Trendelenburg gate. Pain can be mild and movements are restricted for internal rotation and abduction. There may be disuse atrophy in the thighs and buttocks.

Diagnosis requires a high index of suspicion and initial radiographs may be normal.

Management includes non-weight-bearing and referral to an experienced orthopedic surgeon. Surgical or splinting is required to maintain the femoral head within the acetabulum.
